Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rabbi Andy Bachman, from The Jewish Project, 146 Duane Street, New York, New York 10013.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Ranni Andy Bachman from The Jewish Project, 146 Duane Street, New York, N.Y.  10013.

Council Member Chin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 9, 2019 be adopted as printed by Council Member Holden.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Holden moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 9, 2019 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Van Bramer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 201 50th Avenue, Borough of Queens, Council District 26, Community District 2 Application No. 20195511 TCQ (American Brass) shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, American Brass, Queens (20195511 TCQ)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to five-year plans for city streets, sidewalks, and pedestrian spaces
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Five-year plans for city streets, sidewalks, and pedestrian spaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an office to provide support to those in need of burial assistance
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establishment of an office to provide support to those in need of burial assistance.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the fire department to implement a pilot program for the deployment of motorized scooters for the transportation of emergency medical service personnel
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the fire dept to implement a pilot program for the deployment of motorized scooters for the transportation of emergency medical service personnel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation in relation to electronic cigarette advertisements
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Electronic cigarette advertisements.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to cooling centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Cooling centers

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale or use of certain expanded polystyrene items
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Sale or use of certain expanded polystyrene items.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to distribute traffic safety information to students and report on school safety information
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to distribute traffic safety information to students and report on school safety information.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2020.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent  per annum for FY'20.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 7 percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2020 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 7 percent per annum for FY'20 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18 percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2020 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18 percent per annum for FY'20 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution ceremonially designating an area of Brooklyn, within the boundaries of Coney Island Avenue between Church Avenue and Avenue H, as “Little Pakistan”.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Ceremonially designating an area of Brooklyn, within the boundaries of Coney Island Avenue between Church Avenue and Avenue H, as “Little Pakistan”.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Increased fines and penalties for animal abuse.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to imposing a limit upon the real property tax levy
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Imposing a limit upon the real property tax levy.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation extending the property tax exemption provisions to veterans who have served in peacetime operations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extending the property tax exemption provisions to veterans who have served in peacetime operations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and Governor to place a moratorium on psychiatric hospital bed closures and on the New York State Office of Mental Health Transformation Plan and to expand the number of psychiatric-center beds within the city and state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Place a moratorium on psychiatric hospital bed closures and on the NYS Office of Mental Health Transformation Plan and to expand the number of psychiatric-center beds within the city and state.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring notice of the taxi and limousine commission’s annual drug testing requirement.

Items.MatterName: Requirement of bases affiliated with no more than 30 vehicles to dispatch trips to accessible vehicles.

Items.MatterName: DOE and the DHMH to individuals who were students, teachers and staff at schools near the World Trade Center during the 2001-2002 school year.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign S. 485 and H.R. 1230, the Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act. (S.485/H.R.1230)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign the Humane Alternatives to Long-Term Solitary Confinement Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative on this item:
Council Member Borelli and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Humane Alternatives to Long-Term Solitary Confinement Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1343B/A.5493, which would reform revocation presumptive release, parole, conditional release, and post-release supervision.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative on this item:  
Council Member Borelli and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

The following Council Member formally noted his intention to abstain from voting on this item:  
Council Member Ulrich.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Reform revocation presumptive release, parole, conditional release, and post-release supervision. (S.1343B/A.5493)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education (DOE) to ensure that all students have equitable access to after-school athletic activities and associated funding.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: DOE to ensure that all students have equitable access to after-school athletic activities and associated funding.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the  New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to require inclusion of Employee Protection Provisions (EPPs) in all current and future school bus contracts in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his intention to vote negative on this item:
The Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Require inclusion of Employee Protection Provisions (EPPs) in all current and future school bus contracts in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the 75th anniversary of D-Day.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing the 75th anniversary of D-Day.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting held on May 29, 2019.

There is a vacancy in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the Special Election which was held on May 14, 2019 in the 45th Council District in Brooklyn.
The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Meeting was recessed subject to call.
